column1: #Text=Erongarícuaro , also called Eronga , is located on Lake Patzcuaro in the state of Michoacan , Mexico .
#Text=Erongaricuaro , which means " place of waiting " or " place of the watchtower " in the Purhépecha language , is a village in the state of Michoacán , Mexico .
#Text=It is located about an hour and a half drive from Morelia and Uruapan , and 20 minutes from the famous colonial town of Patzcuaro .
#Text=Erongarícuaro , lies just across Lake Pátzcuaro from Pátzcuaro .
#Text=The native Purhépecha from the pueblos near Erongarícuaro come to market day on Tuesdays .
#Text=This ancient town was one of the critical trade points for the Purhepecha empire .
#Text=Friendly to outsiders , Erongarícuaro has hosted artists such as Frida Kahlo and Diego Rivera along with the father of surrealism , Andre Breton , and Russian revolutionary Leon Trotsky .
#Text=Former president Lazaro Cardenas used it as his hideaway across the lake before the road arrived to Erongarícuaro .
#Text=Today Erongarícuaro hosts ex-patriots from Argentina , the United States , France , Germany , Switzerland , and Italy .
#Text=The lively Erongarícuaro plaza has many exotic trees displaying the area 's tolerant climate .
#Text=The pretty colonial-era village of Erongarícuaro lies on the west side of the lake about 17km/11mi from Pátzcuaro .
#Text=During the Second World War a group of French Surrealists found refuge in Erongarícuaro making the village a new Left Bank .
#Text=Stokely Carmichael hid out here during the dangerous years of the 1960s .
#Text=The original Purhépecha village of Erongarícuaro was located up the mountain from the present day village and dates back around two thousand years .
#Text=See the Web site of Dave Haskell , an archaeologist who has studied the area in depth .

#Text=Professor Haskell 's studies indicate pretty clearly that although Erongarícuaro was a part of the Purhé Empire , it was such an important village that it was relatively independent from the main seat of the empire in Tzintzuntzan , probably due to its ties with the villages on the Meseta Purhépecha to the west .
#Text=There are reports that these may no longer run .
#Text=Busses and combis leave from near the statue of Lazaro Cardenas .
#Text=The bus station is farther up though that might be the easiest for you .
#Text=Taxis from Pátzcuaro to Erongarícuaro cost M$ 80 .
#Text=In some seasons potholes can pose a serious hazard to unaware drivers in the stretch between Erongarícuaro and Patzcuaro .
#Text=Drive carefully as the roads have many speed bumps , burros , dogs , cows , and horses .

#Text=From Pátzcuaro , head toward the muelle ( dock ) , and follow the signs to Tocuaro and Erongarícuaro , where you 'll pass through the villages of Huecorio , San Pedro , Tócuaro , Arocutín , San Francisco Uricho , before reaching Erongarícuaro , 17 kilometers from Pátzcuaro .
#Text=Visitors should do most of their exploring by foot in Erongarícuaro .
#Text=The naturalistic crucifix above the altar is known locally as ' El Señor de la Misericordia ' .
#Text=It is an example of 16th century " Pidgin Plateresque " architecture , a style unique to highland Michoacán .

column1: #Text=The large plaza hosts large Banda concerts .
#Text=The Church and monastery was founded by the Franciscans .
#Text=Occasionally the door to the seminary is open and you can see the gardens and views of the lake .
#Text=Permaculture Farms Some of the permaculture farms allow visitors .
#Text=Granja Tierramor Workshops and classes in permaculture .
#Text=Summer Camps for children and high schoolers from Mexico and the US .
#Text=Granja Lolita has horses available for riding .
#Text=Guided walks on the mountains behind the village and plein air sessions can be arranged through Red Star Café and Gallery .
#Text=The Pitaya ( dragonfruit ) farm is only available for tour by special appointment .
#Text=Calle Profesor Urueta Carrillo N° 105 Erongarícuaro , Michoacán , Local call : 34 4 0167 .
#Text=Francisco Castilleja Director of Erongaricuaro Retreat Center .
#Text=P´urepecha ; The Ones who are on a visit .
#Text=The name of the last volcanic lake Indians .
#Text=Reyes Magos , January 6th , is the largest festival in Erongarícuaro .
#Text=The men working in the United States return with their trucks and earnings .
#Text=The plaza has many rides for children
#Text=Festival in honor of the water spirit .
#Text=No ATM is available though across the lake in Patzcuaro there are several .
#Text=The nieve ( ice cream ) , sold in shops on the plaza , is a delightful treat .
#Text=There are many different flavors , made with water or with cream .
#Text=Combinations of flavors add variety and taste .
#Text=Popsicles made from exotic fruits make a pleasant taste adventure .
#Text=Except for early evening there is always food on the plaza .
#Text=Warm atole in the morning and night .
#Text=The bread shop at the lower end of the plaza has wholewheat bread .
#Text=And tortilla shops of all kinds abound .
#Text=Comida Corrida Located on the lower end of the plaza , the last restaurant as you leave the plaza going toward Quiroga .
#Text=Lunch selections vary daily , and include nopales , molé , carne asada , chicken with spices , etc.
#Text=Vegetarian selections are often available as a member of the family business is a vegetarian .
#Text=M$ 35 for traditional main dish , beans , rice , tortillas , salsa and a soda .
#Text=Just after down the slight hill out of town on the way to Patzcuaro , there is a seafood restaurant .
#Text=Lonceria " El 10 " , Lower side of the plaza , Open all day .
#Text=Each Sunday evening the local matriarchs and those in training sit out and sell their homemade goodies .
#Text=Head slightly uphill from the plaza or into any back streets and you will likely find them .
#Text=Do n't ask about the water or food conditions .
#Text=Buy what they have if it looks good and you are not too sensitive .
#Text=These ladies have fed generations of Mexican kids .
#Text=A restaurant serving up trout along with German food amid strains of classical and German pop music .
#Text=You can wander among the former fish raising ponds and feed the geese or fish .
#Text=Trout is brought from the clean waters near Uruapan these days .
#Text=Regional dishes , the best view of the lake .
#Text=On the plaza with available outdoor and indoor seating in a delightful setting .
#Text=This café is run by the Italian-Argentine grandson of pizza purveyors in Argentina and his wife , and the pizza is authentic Italian style .
#Text=The baguette sandwiches are stuffed and wonderful .
#Text=The couple has opened a traditional ice cream shop which is located just next door to Testarelli 's .
#Text=Pizza made with homemade dough ( weekends after noon ) , as well as great whole wheat and multigrain breads , cookies and other sweet breads .
#Text=On the south side of the plaza inside the " Centro Comercial .
